TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback(object collection, object collectionItems);
.class public auto ansi sealed XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback(collection As Object, collectionItems As Object)
public delegate void XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback(System::Object ^ collection, System::Object ^ collectionItems);
type XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback = delegate of obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The collection into which the collection items array is copied.
An array of items to be copied into the object collection.
Docs.summary: Delegate used by the class for deserialization of SOAP-encoded XML data types that map to collections or enumerations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization derived from the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> class. During this process, the .NET Framework generates collection fix-up methods that use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback> delegate. This occurs for SOAP-encoded arrays or SOAP-encoded, multi-reference elements whose data types, in either case, map to .NET Framework collections or enumerations. As necessary, the collection fix-up method is called during deserialization.
You should not directly instantiate <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationCollectionFixupCallback>.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
